summary: This bill, the Charlie Kirk Commemorative Coin Act, mandates the Secretary of the Treasury to mint and issue up to 400,000 silver $1 coins in honor of Charlie Kirk, a late political activist. The bill specifies coin specifications, including weight, diameter, and silver content. The obverse of the coin will feature Kirk's image, while the reverse will include the inscription 'well done, good and faithful servant.' The bill outlines legal tender status, numismatic item designation, design selections, issuance period (2026), and sale prices. The Secretary must ensure the minting process doesn't cost the government.
